verses.verse: When Ephraim<WH669> spoke<WH1696> trembling,<WH7578> he<WH1931> exalted<WH5375> himself in Israel;<WH3478> but when he offended<WH816> in Baal,<WH1168> he died.<WH4191>

And now<WH6258> they sin<WH2398> more and more,<WH3254> and have made<WH6213> them molten images<WH4541> of their silver,<WH4480> <WH3701> and idols<WH6091> according to their own understanding,<WH8394> all<WH3605> of it the work<WH4639> of the craftsmen:<WH2796> they<WH1992> say<WH559> of them, Let the men<WH120> that sacrifice<WH2076> kiss<WH5401> the calves.<WH5695>

Therefore <WH3651> they shall be<WH1961> as the morning<WH1242> cloud,<WH6051> and as the early<WH7925> dew<WH2919> that passeth away,<WH1980> as the chaff<WH4671> that is driven with the whirlwind<WH5590> out of the floor,<WH4480> <WH1637> and as the smoke<WH6227> out of the chimney.<WH4480> <WH699>

Yet I<WH595> am the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> from the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and thou shalt know<WH3045> no<WH3808> god<WH430> but<WH2108> me: for there is no<WH369> savior<WH3467> beside<WH1115> me.

According to their pasture,<WH4830> so were they filled;<WH7646> they were filled,<WH7646> and their heart<WH3820> was exalted;<WH7311> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> have they forgotten<WH7911> me.
Therefore I will be<WH1961> unto them as<WH3644> a lion:<WH7826> as a leopard<WH5246> by<WH5921> the way<WH1870> will I observe<WH7789> them:

I will meet<WH6298> them as a bear<WH1677> that is bereaved<WH7909> of her whelps, and will rend<WH7167> the caul<WH5458> of their heart,<WH3820> and there<WH8033> will I devour<WH398> them like a lion:<WH3833> the wild<WH7704> beast<WH2416> shall tear<WH1234> them.
O Israel,<WH3478> thou hast destroyed<WH7843> thyself; but<WH3588> in me is thine help.<WH5828>

I will be<WH165> thy king:<WH4428> where<WH645> is any other that may save<WH3467> thee in all<WH3605> thy cities?<WH5892> and thy judges<WH8199> of whom<WH834> thou saidst,<WH559> Give<WH5414> me a king<WH4428> and princes?<WH8269>
I gave<WH5414> thee a king<WH4428> in mine anger,<WH639> and took him away<WH3947> in my wrath.<WH5678>
The iniquity<WH5771> of Ephraim<WH669> is bound up;<WH6887> his sin<WH2403> is hid.<WH6845>

The sorrows<WH2256> of a travailing woman<WH3205> shall come<WH935> upon him: he<WH1931> is an unwise<WH3808> <WH2450> son;<WH1121> for<WH3588> he should not<WH3808> stay<WH5975> long<WH6256> in the place of the breaking forth<WH4866> of children.<WH1121>

I will ransom<WH6299> them from the power<WH4480> <WH3027> of the grave;<WH7585> I will redeem<WH1350> them from death:<WH4480> <WH4194> O death,<WH4194> I will be<WH165> thy plagues;<WH1698> O grave,<WH7585> I will be<WH165> thy destruction:<WH6987> repentance<WH5164> shall be hid<WH5641> from mine eyes.<WH4480> <WH5869>

Though <WH3588> he<WH1931> be fruitful<WH6500> among<WH996> his brethren,<WH251> an east wind<WH6921> shall come,<WH935> the wind<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> shall come up<WH5927> from the wilderness,<WH4480> <WH4057> and his spring<WH4726> shall become dry,<WH954> and his fountain<WH4599> shall be dried up:<WH2717> he<WH1931> shall spoil<WH8154> the treasure<WH214> of all<WH3605> pleasant<WH2532> vessels.<WH3627>

Samaria <WH8111> shall become desolate;<WH816> for<WH3588> she hath rebelled<WH4784> against her God:<WH430> they shall fall<WH5307> by the sword:<WH2719> their infants<WH5768> shall be dashed in pieces,<WH7376> and their women with child<WH2030> shall be ripped up.<WH1234>
